pronunciation: COUNTERVAIL, [counter and Latin , to avail or be strong.]

definitions.text:
Countervail
 To act against with equal force, power; equal; act with equivalent effect against any thing; balance; compensate.The profit will hardly countervail the inconveniences.Although the enemy could not countervail the kings damage. Esther 7:4.COUNTERVAIL,
Equal weight strength; power value sufficient obviate any effect; equal weight value; compensation; requital.
